NotificationRequest.title: NotificationRequest
NotificationRequest.description: Represents a request to send a WhatsApp notification via Twilio.

id.description: Unique identifier for the notification request.

phoneNumber.description: The recipient's phone number for the WhatsApp message.

message.description: The message content to be sent.

status.description: The status of the notification request (e.g., pending, sent, failed).

createdAt.description: Timestamp indicating when the notification request was created.

definition.description: Stores notification requests.  Includes all data necessary for processing the request (phoneNumber, message, status, createdAt).

params.name: notificationRequestId
params.description: Unique identifier for the notification request.

firestore.reasoning: Given the requirement for a 'Mini-App de Notificaci√≥n' to validate Firebase and Twilio integration with minimal cost, and the need for secure secret management, the proposed Firestore structure focuses on simplicity and security. Since the application is triggered by a public HTTP request, and the core function is to send a WhatsApp message, we will store the notification requests in a top-level collection. No user-specific data or collaborative access is needed, simplifying the security rules.  Authorization independence is achieved because all necessary data to process the notification request is contained within the `NotificationRequest` document itself; no `get()` calls on parent documents are required. The `list` operation is inherently limited because the cloud function will handle all operations; no direct listing of notification requests from the client is supported, thus fulfilling the QAPs requirement implicitly.
